title: How to request to interview a police officer - Quora
tags: Jobs and Careers in Police and Law Enforcement

response.answer_text: Just ask. Call the Agency (not on 911) and ask to speak with a Supervisor. Tell them what you need. We are not untouchable. Just ask. We especially like talking to citizens to answer questions and help in any way we can. We generally see either traffic violators, criminals, or people who have had a really bad day. Who calls a Cop when they’re having a great day? So talking to someone that just wants an interview, or ask a question, is actually a pleasure.

Call the local station commander and ask to pop in to chat with one or more. It won’t be a problem. If you try and interview an officer by surprise - such as catch them in the street - you will get very guarded answers and may not get the most articulate one of us. Ask to pop in and you’ll get a pick of them, all willing to chat all day long.
